Approximate number of source packages: Tumleweed) counting the entris in the package database file http://download.opensuse.org/tumbleweed/repo/oss/repodata/662416e0920e2bc2bb5ca45e337dcab310325f28ab1e5661d6f876b8dc232103-susedata.xml.gz. Count no architecture and 64bit architecture only to avoid duplicate count via grep 'package pkgid="' '/tmp/662416e0920e2bc2bb5ca45e337dcab310325f28ab1e5661d6f876b8dc232103-susedata.xml' | grep noarch | wc (which gives 16000 and grep 'package pkgid="' '/tmp/662416e0920e2bc2bb5ca45e337dcab310325f28ab1e5661d6f876b8dc232103-susedata.xml' | grep x86_64 | wc (which gives 19000). the script http://inai.de/files/dist/countpkg-suse3 -r 'openSUSE_(Factory|Tumbleweed)'  which inspects the project list from the openSUSE.org Build Service instance and discounts non-SUSE and home projects. Numbers for 13.2: 63438 bin  32707 src; for 42.1: 43401 bin  17428 src. This script seems to count all architectures  so the 63'000 suse number could then be compared to a 630'000 debian number - but debian does not support 10 times more software - so better only count the most popular architecture as for the other entries here.</ref>
